entry.title: Remove std::to_string use in Chrome.
entry.content: It's just a warning right now, so I'm pretty sure it's randomly being ignored. It should be easy to fix this.

entry.title: Missing LCP on https://www.radpowerbikes.com/
entry.content:
Repro steps: 1. Go to https://www.radpowerbikes.com/ 2. Open DevTools and take a performance trace 3. Inspect performance trace result
Expected:
LCP timing to be in the trace
Actual:
LCP timing is missing from the trace. No `largestContentfulPaint::Candidate` events.
This looks similar to b/40139583 since there are a few opacity fade-in animations at the start of the page load. However, disabling those animations with local overrides will still yield results missing LCP.
Related Lighthouse issue: https://github.com/GoogleChrome/lighthouse/issues/15965

entry.title: unrar password encryption does not function inside sandbox
entry.content:
Function `SecHideData` in unrar library attempts to call Windows APIs `CryptUnprotectMemory` and `CryptUnprotectMemory` however these APIs will not work because crypt32.dll will not load in the sandbox.
Indeed, by dynamic instrumentation it is possible to see that these two calls to `GetProcAddress` fail with `(NTSTATUS) 0xc0000022 - {Access Denied}` as they are blocked.
https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/unrar/src/secpassword.cpp;l=43
We should consider just removing these calls entirely, as they don't really add anything for Chromium - or alternatively pre-loading the crypt32.dll inside the utility sandbox. However, I think even if we preload, these `Crypt*Memory` calls are likely to fail in a service sandbox because they do LPC to lsass.exe and would likely need pre-warming. This would require further research.
Given need for research and the lack of concrete benefit of making these calls in the first place (at no point in the call is the password ever a secret), my recommendation is simply to remove these calls.

entry.title: Upload Report button should handle report scheduler initialization better.
entry.content:
Scheduler for both browser and profiles are created async. So there is a tiny bit of time that upload report button on chrome://policy page does nothing as scheduler hasn't been created yet.
We could hide the button for those cases, or at least print an error message so that people can try again later.

entry.title: Code cleanup: merge 2 handler functions for Safety Hub handler
entry.content:
Two handler functions: - `SafetyHubHandler::HandleGetSafetyHubHasRecommendations` - `SafetyHubHandler::HandleGetSafetyHubEntryPointSubheader`
are currently used and called from the same place and share functionality.
Merge them to optimize and simplify the code.

entry.title: Tests are failing: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'void org.chromium.chrome.browser.profiles.ProfileKeyedMap.destroy()' on a null ob...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'void org.chromium.chrome.browser.profiles.ProfileKeyedMap.destroy()' on a null object reference
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.page_info.PageInfoViewDarkModeTest#testChromePage - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.incognito.IncognitoPermissionLeakageTest#testAllowPermissionDoNotLeakFromIncognitoToIncognito__INCOGNITO_CCT_INCOGNITO_CCT - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.incognito.IncognitoStorageLeakageTest#testSessionStorageDoesNotLeakFromActivityToActivity__REGULAR_CCT_REGULAR_CCT - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.incognito.IncognitoStorageLeakageTest#testStorageDoesNotLeakFromActivityToActivity__REGULAR_CCT_REGULAR_CCT - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.share.share_sheet.ShareSheetTest#nothingFromDefaultRankingAvailable
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - test variant(s) are being exonerated (ignored) in presubmit
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/97d39a96ad128bbbbc43ab218aab1558
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Create dual sets of team bug query links for both Chrome (Internal) and Chromium (Public)
entry.content:
1. before in Monorail , all Chrome and Chromium bugs are all under Chromium project, all team bug query use the identical url for query 2. after we migrate to Buganizer, now we have Chrome(internal) and Chromium (public) 2 components using 2 different URL
That has caused the mismatch in bug count from dashboard and bug query, since bug query can only link to one URL, the other set of internal bugs using b-corp.google.com don't show up.
We will add a new feature to show 2 bug query links in the dashboard , one using b-corp.google.com ,and one using g-issue-chromium.org.
By default the top link use b-corp.google.com that will show all the bugs , bug count in query result and dashboard will match. The additional query link with (Public) tag will only show query from g-issue-chromium.org to accommodate teams who need to share bug query links with external chromium contributors.

Please use hotlists and text to provide additional information.
If this is a regression (i.e., worked before), please consider using the bisect tool (https://www.chromium.org/developers/bisect-builds-py) to help us identify the root cause and more rapidly triage the issue.
For graphics-related bugs, please copy/paste the contents of the about://gpu page at the end of this report.

entry.title: RegistrationsPerRedirectChain metric measures incorrectly
entry.content: The [`Conversions.RegistrationsPerRedirectChain` metric](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/core/frame/attribution_src_loader.cc;l=883-887;drc=a30b52e756c4ba3bc9c2a82b64c9045fde178bc4) is incorrect because only background requests use the same `ResourceClient` across an entire redirect chain. As a result, non-background requests will cause the metric to be recorded with value `1` `n` times instead of `n` 1 time.

entry.title: PRESUBMIT.py `KeyError: 'hooks'`
entry.content:
Bug in PRESUBMIT.py causing this KeyError:
``` ** Presubmit ERRORS: 1 ** Evaluation of CheckForNewDEPSDownloadFromGoogleStorageHooks failed: 'hooks', Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/local/google/home/trishalfonso/bug-chromium/src/depot_tools/presubmit_support.py", line 1837, in _run_check_function result = eval(function_name + '(*__args)', context) ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File "<string>", line 1, in <module> File "/usr/local/google/home/trishalfonso/chromium/src/PRESUBMIT.py", line 3188, in CheckForNewDEPSDownloadFromGoogleStorageHooks old_hooks = _ParseDeps('\n'.join(f.OldContents()))['hooks'] ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^ KeyError: 'hooks' ```
This looks like a bug in the script causing this error. This function was added in crrev.com/c/5447679.
Assigning to kimstephanie@google.com as the owner of the commit.

entry.title: Zero copy broken on experimental Win/NVIDIA tester
entry.content:
Starting in [this build](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20FYI%20x64%20Exp%20Release%20(NVIDIA)/17253/infra), the following tests started failing in `trace_test`
``` VideoPathTraceTest_DirectComposition_Underlay VideoPathTraceTest_DirectComposition_Underlay_Fullsize VideoPathTraceTest_DirectComposition_Video_MP4 VideoPathTraceTest_DirectComposition_Video_MP4_FourColors_Aspect_4x3 VideoPathTraceTest_DirectComposition_Video_MP4_Fullsize VideoPathTraceTest_DirectComposition_Video_MP4_NV12 VideoPathTraceTest_DirectComposition_Video_MP4_Rounded_Corner ```
Every failure is due to:
``` trace_integration_test.py(776): AssertionError: ZeroCopy mismatch, expected True got False ```
Blamelist is [here](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20FYI%20x64%20Exp%20Release%20(NVIDIA)/17253/blamelist). [This CL](https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5459023) seems suspicious to me, so assigning to the author to confirm whether this could be the cause.

entry.title: Private Network Access prompt on Android
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Build a working example on chromium desktop using an HTTP server with the right PNA headers 2. The example works correctly on desktop and chromium shows the prompt and fetches the resources as expected 3. The same example fails immediately on Chromium Android
# Problem Description The Private Network Access prompt is not available on Android. The chromium flag (which is not necessary as of M124, is showing "Not available on your platform" and only "Mac, Windows, Linux, ChromeOS, Fuchsia and Lacros" are listed as the supported platforms.
What would prevent the implementation of the prompt on Android ?
# Summary Private Network Access prompt on Android
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>SecurityFeature
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chrome problem
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: No

entry.title: ExtensionApiTest.UpdateWindowSizeExitsFullscreen is flaky
entry.content:
ExtensionApiTest.UpdateWindowSizeExitsFullscreen is flaky on Windows and Linux [1], most notably causing consistent win-rel-ready failures [2]. The test is already disabled on Mac. Example failure:
[ RUN ] ExtensionApiTest.UpdateWindowSizeExitsFullscreen [8856:9280:0418/101142.592:WARNING:chrome_main_delegate.cc(742)] This is Chrome version 126.0.6427.0 (not a warning) [8856:9280:0418/101142.623:INFO:chrome_browser_cloud_management_controller.cc(168)] Starting CBCM Controller Initialization [8856:9280:0418/101142.623:INFO:chrome_browser_cloud_management_controller.cc(196)] No machine level policy manager exists. [8856:9280:0418/101142.654:WARNING:browser_management_service.cc(128)] EnterpriseLogoUrl fetch failed with error code -1 and MIME type [8856:9280:0418/101142.920:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] "[FAIL] setResizeWindow: API Test Error in setResizeWindow Actual: 9 Expected: 10 Error at extensions::test:257:18 at checkLeftAndContinue (chrome-extension://jcacaacpdajgjnchbjfhcfgfpcmjldpd/test.js:35:15) at safeFunctionApply (extensions::test:40:26) at extensions::test:401:18", source: chrome-extension://jcacaacpdajgjnchbjfhcfgfpcmjldpd/test.html (0) ..\..\chrome\browser\extensions\extension_fullscreen_apitest.cc(68): error: Value of: RunExtensionTest("window_update/sizing") Actual: false Expected: true Failed 1 of 1 tests Stack trace: extensions::ExtensionApiTest_UpdateWindowSizeExitsFullscreen_Test::RunTestOnMainThread [0x00007FF6794AC708+520] (o:\chrome\browser\extensions\extension_fullscreen_apitest.cc:68) content::BrowserTestBase::ProxyRunTestOnMainThreadLoop [0x00007FF67EC0BE38+856] (o:\content\public\test\browser_test_base.cc:942) content::BrowserMainLoop::InterceptMainMessageLoopRun [0x00007FF67C84D629+121] (o:\content\browser\browser_main_loop.cc:1074) content::BrowserMainLoop::RunMainMessageLoop [0x00007FF67C84D6C2+34] (o:\content\browser\browser_main_loop.cc:1086) content::BrowserMainRunnerImpl::Run [0x00007FF67C84F7C1+17] (o:\content\browser\browser_main_runner_impl.cc:160) content::BrowserMain [0x00007FF67C84A238+200] (o:\content\browser\browser_main.cc:34) content::RunBrowserProcessMain [0x00007FF67E12E038+264] (o:\content\app\content_main_runner_impl.cc:708) content::ContentMainRunnerImpl::RunBrowser [0x00007FF67E12F478+680] (o:\content\app\content_main_runner_impl.cc:1306) content::ContentMainRunnerImpl::Run [0x00007FF67E12F156+966] (o:\content\app\content_main_runner_impl.cc:1155) content::RunContentProcess [0x00007FF67E12D599+969] (o:\content\app\content_main.cc:329) content::ContentMain [0x00007FF67E12D978+136] (o:\content\app\content_main.cc:342) content::BrowserTestBase::SetUp [0x00007FF67EC0B13B+2795] (o:\content\public\test\browser_test_base.cc:608) InProcessBrowserTest::SetUp [0x00007FF67E80F367+439] (o:\chrome\test\base\in_process_browser_test.cc:645)
[8856:9280:0418/101143.881:WARNING:pref_notifier_impl.cc(41)] Pref observer for media_router.cast_allow_all_ips found at shutdown. [ FAILED ] ExtensionApiTest.UpdateWindowSizeExitsFullscreen, where TypeParam = and GetParam() = (1287 ms)
thakis@, could you help triage this? I know it's a really old test, but code archeology reveals some degree of involvement on it from you. Thank you!
[1] https://ci.chromium.org/ui/test/chromium/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchrome%2Ftest%3Ainteractive_ui_tests%2FExtensionApiTest.UpdateWindowSizeExitsFullscreen [2] https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/win-rel-ready/20489/overview

entry.title: Regression in numerous GPU pixel tests
entry.content:
We recently started getting a bunch of pixel test failures on multiple platforms due to untriaged images. A number of these are normal differences, e.g. slightly different pixels around edges. However, certain tests on certain configurations are clearly wrong.
For example, [this](https://chrome-gold.skia.org/detail?grouping=name%3DPixel_CanvasLowLatencyWebGLRoundedCorners%26source_type%3Dchrome-gpu&digest=dc07e52f84841a0013a0c718a89cb2bb) Win/Intel result for `Pixel_CanvasLowLatencyWebGLRoundedCorners` no longer has anti-aliasing around the corners.
Blamelist for that is [here](https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Win10%20FYI%20x64%20Experimental%20Release%20(Intel)/1576/blamelist), will try to bisect.

entry.title: Video Effects Service should switch to //third_party/dawn/include/dawn:cpp_headers deps once Dawn rolls
entry.content:
Bug filed to keep track of CR comment at https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5441165/comment/bc15743e_4ec2dd67/.
Once Dawn rolls, we should switch from depending on //third_party/dawn/src/dawn:cpp in Video Effects Service. The WebGPU C++ wrapper is going to become header-only. Depending on //third_party/dawn/include/dawn:cpp_headers should be sufficient.

Scroll arrows in Chrome's context menus

# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Press right click or the hamburger menu in the top right corner 2. 3.
# Problem Description It happens randomly, especially when you have more extensions installed, the menu can't keep every option on screen since it's very big so what it does is that scroll arrows appear and that shouldn't happen since a context menu should show everything at once.
# Summary Scroll arrows in Chrome's context menus
# Additional Data Category: UI \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Upgrade Win/Intel capacity reserved for branch builders
entry.content:
The majority of the Win/Intel UHD 630 fleet is being upgraded to a new OS and driver in b/331793619. However, we're setting aside 20 machines for branch builders until they age out. This bug will be used to periodically check in on the branches to see if any have aged out.
Currently, M122, M123, M124, and M125 are all active, with M122 and M124 marked as extended support.

entry.title: Don't show ESB Download Row Promo when user is not in google chrome branding
entry.content: As directed by UX and my PM, we should not show this ESB promotion if it's on chromium.

entry.title: Chevron style update missed for permission rows
entry.content:
Recent GM3 design updates changed the filled in chevron to a line-style chevron. However it seems this update was not applied to permission rows (see screenshot).
Permission rows should use same [chevron icon](https://fonts.google.com/icons?selected=Material%20Symbols%20Outlined%3Achevron_right%3AFILL%400%3Bwght%40400%3BGRAD%400%3Bopsz%4024) as the Connection security and Cookies & site data rows above and below.

entry.title: Dashboard bug count does not match bug query for Chrome T &S
entry.content:
There are mis-match in bug count between Chrome Platform quality dashboards and buganizer query result.
This could be bug security access issue. however eng team owner should not have access issue to view bugs that map to bug components they own.
We need to find out what is missing here to prevent eng team owners from viewing bugs in their own components.

entry.title: Tests are failing: v8_context_tracker_browsertest.cc(87): Expected: (v8ct->GetV8ContextCountForTesting()) >= (current_counts_.v8_context_count + count_change.v8_conte...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): v8_context_tracker_browsertest.cc(87): Expected: (v8ct->GetV8ContextCountForTesting()) >= (current_counts_.v8_context_count + count_change.v8_context_count), actual: 0 vs 1
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://components:components_browsertests/V8ContextTrackerTest.AboutBlank - ninja://components:components_browsertests/V8ContextTrackerTest.SameSiteNavigation - ninja://components:components_browsertests/V8ContextTrackerTest.DetachedContext
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/d0249f588e9d3d9c9c0d08db57f20015
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection

entry.title: Spanify DataBuffer class.
entry.content:
Spanify [DataBuffer](https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:media/base/data_buffer.h;drc=9cfda18d6a9a7f5721fd41d32422e07a2c133167;l=26) class.
`DataBuffer` class should use a span instead of manager buffer access via ptr + size.

entry.title: [Protected Audience] Use multiple threads to run ScoreAd
entry.content: This could improve the auction performance

entry.title: SCT Hashdance tests depend on Argon 2023 being in log_list.json
entry.content:
SCTHashdanceBrowserTests rely on the Argon 2023 log being in the Chrome bundled log_list.json, (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ssl/sct_reporting_service_browsertest.cc;drc=079e6e95e7898ea44fb118b615eb05be2d24f8f1;l=75). While SCT verification results can be faked for tests so they treat SCTs from the log as valid, the actual SCT reporting codepath these tests are testing need information from the log list, and break when the log is missing (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:services/network/sct_auditing/sct_auditing_handler.cc;drc=98aa66ef9bb060085f1cdca463a8059d36ebe9e3;l=165).
This has been causing automated updates to log_list.json to fail since this log was removed from the log list in february (when it transitioned to rejected). (e.g. crrev.com/c/5461508)
This can be fixed by triggering an update to the log list in the test setup so this log is added.

Version: 15481-ab9382a From Link: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/labs/p/chromium-m124/inv/build-8750499032391813505/test/ninja%3A%2F%2Fchromeos%2Flacros%3Alacros_all_tast_tests%2Ftast.a11y.Smoke.lacros/variant/d390d9d42e5ff7d2?resultIndex=0 Error Message: code: 7 (PERMISSION_DENIED) desc: caller does not have permission resultdb.artifacts.list in realm of invocation u-chromeos-test-2024-04-16-13-15-00-4ceff6bcd7158529
Stacktrace: Error: code: 7 (PERMISSION_DENIED) desc: caller does not have permission resultdb.artifacts.list in realm of invocation u-chromeos-test-2024-04-16-13-15-00-4ceff6bcd7158529

entry.title: Web NFC Read-Only Broken
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Go to the demo pages at https://googlechrome.github.io/samples/web-nfc/ 2. Press Make Read-Only 3. Bring a tag to the NFC sensor 4. Chrome will freeze and the tag will not be made read-only.
# Problem Description The read-only function a part of the web nfc spec has stopped working. Any website that tries to use the API results in chrome freezing whenever an NFC tag is broght to the reader after the function is called.
# Summary Web NFC Read-Only Broken
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue Feature currently only available in chrome for android.
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: v8.log cannot bet written on android
entry.content: Seems like we can log to sdcard with `--single-process`, maybe that's worth documenting.

entry.title: Auto-sizes value is not piped to Sec-CH-Width
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. In the latest Canary, go to https://cdpn.io/pen/debug/LYvgZvZ 2. Notice that all images were requested with a Sec-CH-Width header of 100vw * window.devicePixelRatio, instead of their resolved sizes=auto value * window.devicePixelRatio
# Problem Description The default sizes value is 100vw. I believe that's being used here, instead of the resolved sizes=auto value, when generating the Sec-CH-Width header.
# Summary Auto-sizes value is not piped to Sec-CH-Width
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Not sure - I don't know
#### Does this feature work correctly in other browsers? No - I can reproduce the problem in another browser
#### Details of interop issue No other browser currently supports sizes=auto OR client hints at all, so this isn't really an interop issue
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Canary \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Update --help to include how to run on android
entry.content: Currently there is no clear documentation on how to select a and android browser for running benchmarks.

entry.title: Registration API token endpoint does not work, at least if multi IDP is enabled
entry.content:
Steps to reproduce: See instructions on https://github.com/sjud/fedcm-example-rp
The problem is here: https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/blink/renderer/modules/credentialmanagement/web_identity_requester.cc;l=65;drc=08bac9d4c75f023df86a07be1986884f760dab94 if (!providers.Contains(selected_idp_config_url)) {
Because we requested this as "any" but we get back a specific IDP's config URL, they don't match, so we reject the promise assuming that the user chose a different IDP.
If multi-IDP is disabled, I believe we use a different codepath that may not have this issue (?)

entry.title: WebCodecs decode error for valid H.264 when using D3D11 HW decoder
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Unzip the attached example and host it via HTTPS 2. Open the attached example, and open DevTools 3. Click "Play" 4. In DevTools, observe the error "Uncaught DOMException: Decoding error." 5. In the Media Tab in Dev Tools observe the error:
Error Group: DecoderStatus Error Code: 1 Stacktrace: media\gpu\windows\d3d11_video_decoder.cc:1064 Caused by: Error Group: D3D11Status Error Code: 6 Data: VDA Error: 0 Stacktrace: media\gpu\windows\d3d11_video_decoder.cc:762
6. In the JS code, uncomment the line to prefer-software (line 46) and retry the sample 7. Observe playback works OK with the software decoder
# Problem Description Attempting to decode a valid GOP of H.264 (generated by NVENC) using the HW decoder (D3D11) results in an error. Uncaught DOMException: Decoding error.
The bitstream appears to be correct, and plays OK via MPEG DASH, or when via WebCodecs when preferring SW decoder.
# Additional Comments Same problem exists in other Chromium browsers. Firefox doesn't support WebCodecs. I cannot test Safari as I don't have a Mac.
# Summary WebCodecs decode error for valid H.264 when using D3D11 HW decoder
# Custom Questions #### Which component does this fall under? Blink>Media
#### Does this work in other browsers? Not sure - I don't know
# Additional Data Category: API \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: Record the number of auto-revoked permissions per type
entry.content: On each run of auto-revocation record the number of revoked permissions per permission type.

entry.title: Graphite initialize failed if monitored fence is not supported on Windows
entry.content: Some old GPU drivers don't support monitored fecne, so ID3D11Fence cannot be created. We need to figure out a way to support those devices

entry.title: Suggest password available to non syncing users
entry.content:
Create a new chrome profile associated with a google account. Make sure the account doesn't have any saved passwords and that the account is not syncing. (not sure, but maybe the bug reproduces also if the account has saved passwords).
Go to https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/ and right click on the password field. Wait a few minutes and then right click again. "Suggest password" is now displayed in the context menu.
Proof: [video](http://go/scrcast/NjY0MzU5NzA2NjYzMzIxNnwwMjczZDg1YS1hNQ).

entry.title: whatsapp not working
entry.content:
This template is for filing bugs against Android System WebView. Chrome bugs should be filed at https://crbug.com/wizard.
Android device name:
Android OS version:
Android System WebView version: (Settings > Apps > the 3 dots in the upper right > Show system. On Android N (7.x) through P (9.0), please include Chrome's version. Otherwise, look for "Android System WebView")
Application: (package name or Play Store URL)
Application version:
Steps to reproduce:
1. 2. 3.
Expected result:
Actual result:
Did this work before? (last working WebView version, or N/A)
---
It's especially helpful if you can capture a bug report right after you experience the bug, and attach it here. See https://developer.android.com/studio/debug/bug-report for instructions.
Screen recordings can also be very helpful - see https://developer.android.com/studio/command-line/adb#screenrecord. Please enable "Show taps" in developer settings.
